attributes.action: Lobby OPEC to increase production which will decrease prices of crude oil and channel current fuel taxes into alternative energy research and production
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Oil production, distribution and price regulation is the remit of OPEC. It’s objective is to co-ordinate and unify petroleum policies among Member Countries, in order to secure fair and stable prices for petroleum producers; an efficient, economic and regular supply of petroleum to consuming nations; and a fair return on capital to those investing in the industry. A great idea but how effective is it at its main purpose and how fair is it to UK consumers?

OPEC has recently agreed to raise production by 500,000 barrels a day today. Unfortunately, the global commodity markets reacted with a great big shrug – the price of crude for October delivery was up to $78.23 a barrel. It's highest price ever.

So a new daily output, which when measured in August was 30.37 million bpd —slightly lower than output in 1979. I call upon the British Government to lobby OPEC to live up to it's initial remit and increase production to compensate for the global demand increases since 1979. I also call on the government to use the already imposed fuel duties to pump-prime research, development and sustainable deployment into alternative non-global-warming energy supplies before its too late.
